answers.answer: It helps us help you better if you are more specific when posting test results. Are your posted results mmo/l or A1c? If the former was it fasting, OGTT, or random?HCV and diabetes have nothing in common, except that, we, as humans, shouldn't have them. Sorry to hear you didn't reach SVR.
If this was a fasting test you are pre-diabetic. There is a lot of research that supports Hepatitis C leads to Type II diabetes.  Talk to your endo about this, they will know best.
it was 6 mmol/l from venous blood.

question: hello everybody,i hope i can get some infos here about diabetes in hep-c patients.i have chronic hep-c,and im a nonresponder waiting for the the new drugs come out.on my last year lab results glucose was 4.8,this year showed 6.0.does that mean i have diabetes?thanks for some answers
title: diabetes/hep-c question
